title: 2021 (song)
text:
"2021" is a song by American <a href="indie%20pop">indie pop</a> band <a href="Vampire%20Weekend">Vampire Weekend</a>. Alongside "<a href="Harmony%20Hall%20%28song%29">Harmony Hall</a>", it served as the <a href="double%20A-side">double A-side</a> lead single for their fourth studio album "<a href="Father%20of%20the%20Bride%20%28album%29">Father of the Bride</a>", and was released on January 24, 2019, by <a href="Columbia%20Records">Columbia Records</a>.
Composition.
The "sparse lovelorn ballad" is built around a sample of the ambient track "Talking", composed in the 1980s by <a href="Haruomi%20Hosono">Haruomi Hosono</a> for Japanese retail company <a href="Muji">Muji</a>. It features a soft pulsing synth and fingerpicked guitars, along with a distorted vocal sample of the word "boy" sung by <a href="Jenny%20Lewis">Jenny Lewis</a>.
Personnel.
Credits adapted from <a href="Qobuz">Qobuz</a>.
Musicians
Engineers
